intro: Feretia canthioides, commonly known as the purple-veined orchid, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with purple veins on a white background. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and efficient water retention. Feretia canthioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
